content.question: By collecting the appropriate data, the students can determine the relationship between the acceleration of the cart and the net force exerted on the cart. Which of the following graphs should the students produce to show the correct relationship?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Net Force.” The vertical axis is labeled “Acceleration.” There are no numbers indicated on either axis. The line begins at the origin, and moves steadily upward and to the right. The line ends high above the horizontal axis, and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure presents the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Net Force.” The vertical axis is labeled “Acceleration.” There are no numbers indicated on either axis. The line begins on the vertical axis, high above the origin, and moves steadily downward and to the right. The line ends on the horizontal axis, far to the right of the origin.

The figure presents the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Net Force.” The vertical axis is labeled “Acceleration.” There are no numbers indicated on either axis. The line begins on the vertical axis, approximately halfway up the axis. It moves horizontally to the right until it ends far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Net Force.” The vertical axis is labeled “Acceleration.” There are no numbers indicated on either axis. The curve begins at the origin, and moves gradually upward and to the right until it reaches approximately halfway along the horizontal axis. At this point, the curve moves more steeply upward and to the right, until it ends high above the horizontal axis, and far to the right of the vertical axis.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Net Force.” The vertical axis is labeled “Acceleration.” There are no numbers indicated on either axis. The line begins at the origin, and moves steadily upward and to the right. The line ends high above the horizontal axis, and far to the right of the vertical axis.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
